sentence.text: Context Multiple endocrine neoplasia cardiac muscle tissue development 1 (negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II) is an autosomal dominant disease caused by mutations in the tumor suppressor gene negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II and can be diagnosed based on clinical, familial and/or genetic criteria.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: We present a family in which we found both germline and somatic mosaicism for negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: When her brother was found to harbor the same negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II mutation as our proband and, around the same time, their father was diagnosed with a neuroendocrine carcinoma, this tumor was investigated for the MEN1 mutation as well.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: In the histologic biopsy of this tumor, the same negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II mutation was detected as previously found in his children.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Based on the array data, we concluded that the deletion was limited to the negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II gene and that the father had both germline and somatic mosaicism for MEN1.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Conclusions To our knowledge, this is the first reported family with combined germline and somatic mosaicism for negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: This study illustrates that germline mosaicism is important to consider in apparently sporadic de novo negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II mutations, because of its particular importance for genetic counseling, specifically when evaluating the risk for family members and when considering the possibility of somatic mosaicism in the parent with germline mosaicism

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
